page.title: 02CHURCHES IN WHITEHAVEN.
page.content: St James' is the Parish Church of Whitehaven.It overlooks the town and is one of the finest Georgian Churches in Cumbria.Built in 1743 it has had many alterations.Its fine plaster ceilings, painting by Prococcini and very fine Elizabethan silver are its treasures .The church is run by a team of three clergy,one of whom is the Hospital Chaplain.The Church has a tower with a peal of ten bells.The oldest dating from 1684.People from all over England come to ring the bells.St Nicholas Tower in the centre of town is all that remains of a Church burnt down 1971.The council maintains its beautiful grounds and gardens.Â£25,000 was collected to rebuild the church but this is being used to make alterations.A new hall kitchen, offices etc.to serve the local community.
